They saw with their own eyes what is kept in such caves, or rather reinforced terrorist bunkers,‚Äù the Russian general said. ‚ÄúThere were large stockpiles of weapons and ammunition, including those Western-made, prisons, holes to cover tanks, gas masks, food and medical supplies.‚Äù

The world‚Äôs biggest natural killers

Did you know that 54% of deaths in the world are due to just TEN top causes? That‚Äôs according to World Health Organization‚Äôs analysis of 56.9 million deaths worldwide in 2016.

The world‚Äôs most lethal killers proved to be ischemic heart disease and stroke combining for 15.2 million deaths in 2016. These diseases have remained the leading causes of death globally in the past 15 years.

In developing economies, deaths were primarily caused by infectious, maternal, neonatal and nutritional conditions. By contrast, only 7% of deaths in high-income countries were due to such cases. Non-communicable diseases (NCDs) such as stroke, cancer, diabetes, and dementia caused 71% of deaths globally with most of them (88%) occurring in high-income economies.

4.9 million deaths were due to injuries with more than a quarter of those being road traffic injuries.

Cause-of-death statistics are an important part of assessing the effectiveness of a country‚Äôs health system as they help authorities determine and prioritize public health activities such as prevention techniques or treatments.
